product.title: Frogs In Clogs | Book Club by Early Moments
product.text:
Frogs in Clogs
by Sheila White Samton

Frogs in clogs happily play in a bog with pigs in wigs that share their figs. But when some greedy bugs on rugs show up, there’s trouble! Will the frogs be able to rescue the pigs? Frogs in Clogs is written with simple words that will help early readers practice their phonics skills. This entertaining story by Sheila White Samton will have readers rhyming away.

Tie-in Activity: Draw or paste pictures of 20 pairs of rhyming words onto individual index cards or old playing cards (e.g. one card shows a mouse, its match shows a house). Play the game as you would “Go Fish” but instead of asking for a matching number, ask for a matching rhyme.
